content.rendered:
The General Election is on Tuesday, November 5.

 

Resources for California Voters

  • California Secretary of State – General Election webpage
  • Same Day Voter Registration in California
  • CalMatters non-partisan, non-profit journalism dedicated to explaining  California policy and politics.
  • Ballotpedia – sample ballot lookup and research tool
  • League of  Women Voters non-partisan organization, working to empower and educate voters.
  • Los Angeles County, Registrar-Recorder/County Clerk Voting and Elections information

 

The University of La Verne is a Vote Center* 

Vote center  location: Abraham Campus Center, Third Floor Ballrooms, 2000 2nd Street, La Verne, CA 91750
Early Voting Period: November 2-4, 10am to 7pm
Election Day: November 5, 7am to 8pm

Parking: Designated Voter parking  will be available along 2nd  Street during Early Voting and Election Day. Additional parking is in parking structure behind Abraham Campus Center.

* The ULV Vote Center is for registered voters in Los Angeles county.

 

Vote early | Voting by Mail

Any registered voter may vote using a vote-by-mail ballot instead of going to the polls on Election Day. If you are voting by mail, it’s very important to fill out your ballots accurately. After you have voted, insert your ballot in the envelope provided, making sure you complete all required information on the envelope.
Vote-by-Mail Drop Ballot Drop Off Locations
 

Are you curious about the mail-in-voting process?
Watch this short clip that explains what happens to your ballot and how election officials in California maintain the security and integrity of your vote.

 

Track your ballot!
You can find out where your ballot is at wheresmyballot.sos.ca.gov.  Sign up on this site to track your ballot after you have mailed it back or turned it in!

 

 

ULV Nonpartisan Democratic Engagement Recognition
